Detailed Description

Looks after all MoveablePointer to a block of memory, and also the memory itself.

A NewMemoryBlock is basically an extendable, moveable block of memory which keeps track of all pointers into it, and moves them when approriate.

The main limitation of NewMemoryBlocks is that it is impossible to delete or alter particular allocations without deleting the whole class. This may be fixed in future if it is required.
